thread.title: Why Congress Sees ZTE as a National-Security Threat

author: Shelby Holliday
title: Why Congress Sees ZTE as a National-Security Threat
text:
2 COMMENTS One Chinese request in trade talks with the U.S. is a reprieve for Chinese telecom company ZTE as it falters under U.S. sanctions.
President Donald Trump tweeted early last week that he would work with Chinese president Xi Jinping to get the company “back into business, fast,” defending it as part of negotiations with China.
But U.S. lawmakers from both parties have criticized any effort to ease restrictions on the company, calling ZTE a security threat . In the video above, we explain why.
